sn55.20:4.2: As easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm,
sn55.20:4.4: vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared among the gods of the Thirty-Three.
sn55.20:4.5: Then several gods of the company of the Thirty-Three went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna,
sn55.20:4.6: bowed, and stood to one side.
sn55.20:5.1: “Reverends, it’s good to have experiential confidence in the Buddha. …
sn55.20:5.4: It’s the reason why some sentient beings are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.20:5.5: It’s good to have experiential confidence in the teaching. …
sn55.20:5.7: and to have the ethical conduct that’s loved by the noble ones …
sn55.20:5.9: It’s the reason why some sentient beings are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
